thread.title: Vin Scully to Miss 2015 Postseason

author: MICHAEL DUARTE
title: Vin Scully to Miss 2015 Postseason
text: Contact Us Dodgers Hall of Fame Broadcaster Vin Scully to Miss Postseason The Los Angeles Dodgers announced on Thursday that Hall of Fame broadcaster Vin Scully will miss the entire 2015 postseason after undergoing a medical procedure. Privacy Policy | More Newsletters File - Getty Images The Los Angeles Dodgers announced that broadcaster Vin Scully will miss the entire 2015 postseason after undergoing a minor medical procedure. Here's Scully at Dodger Stadium on September 23, 2015 in Los Angeles, California. Just 24 hours away from Game 1 of their National League Division Series against the New York Mets, the Los Angeles Dodgers announced that a key member of their team would miss the entire postseason. Don't worry, fans, it's not Clayton Kershaw or Zack Greinke. Instead, Hall of Fame broadcaster Vin Scully will miss the postseason after undergoing a medical procedure on Thursday morning. Retirement is 'Frightening' for Vin Scully Scully missed the team's four-game series in San Francisco last week and the team's final three games at Dodger Stadium over the weekend due to an undisclosed illness. We're still not sure what the illness was or the severity of it, but apparently it did require minor surgery. The team announced that Scully is resting comfortably at this time, and has been advised by his doctors to miss the entire 2015 postseason. Vin Scully Says He Will Return Next Season to Call Dodgers Games "Everyone in the Dodgers organization wishes Vin the speediest of recoveries," the team said. Scully will return for his 67th season in 2016, and is looking forward to returning next year said the team. Kate Larsen reports for the NBC4 News at 6 p.m. on Saturday, Aug. 29, 2015. (Published Saturday, Aug. 29, 2015) We wish Vin a speedy recovery. Published 21 minutes ago
